Kolumna Miše Terček: Skrita kamera kot grozljivka
Pri nas smo imeli Mita Trefalta in Francija Keka, ki bi ju lahko okategorizirali kot klasika, a skrita kamera se na naših tleh od devetdesetih let nikoli ni razvila.
05 Nov 2019, 09:10 by Novice



Rojstvo Nezemljana na skriti kameri FOTOGRAFIJI: NETFLIX



Gaten Matarazzo, voditelj oddaje


Klasična skrita kamera je na televiziji že zelo preživet format, ki je obstal nekje v začetku devetdesetih. A ker je element presenečanja, ko nekoga nevede spraviš v situacijo, ki ni resnična, za gledalce še vedno zanimiv (saj ga je mogoče izpeljati na tisoč in en način), si televizijske (pa tudi internetne) hiše vedno znova izmišljujejo nove koncepte, kako skrito kamero posodobiti in jo vkomponirati v modernejše oblike resničnostnih oddaj. Preporod skrite kamere je z unikatnim pristopom začel Ashton Kutcher s serijo oddaj Punk'd, ki jih je leta 2003 začel predvajati MTV. Tam je zvezdnik druge zvezdnike spravljal v neprijetne in nenavadne situacije ter tik preden so jim popustili živci, razkril, da gre pravzaprav za potegavščino. Produkcijsko in proračunsko je bila oddaja zastavljena na dokaj visoki ravni, zaradi visoke gledanosti in prepoznavnosti pa je pritegnila pozornost oglaševalcev, tako da so v naslednjih letih kakovost in nore ideje zgolj stopnjevali. Punk'd je navdihoval številne sorodne sodobne skrite kamere, ki jih je nato po televizijah znova kar mrgolelo.Pri nas smo imeli Mita Trefalta in Francija Keka, ki bi ju lahko okategorizirali kot klasika, a skrita kamera se na naših tleh od devetdesetih let (in nekaj poznejših medlih poizkusih) nikoli ni razvila naprej in jo je pričakovano povozil čas. A s tujimi formati oddaj, ki so bili že svetlobna leta naprej (in z dostopnostjo kabelskih, satelitskih in spletnih programov), je bilo za slovenske televizije v neki točki težko tekmovati. In tako je tudi danes.Netflix je v teh tednih startal novo posebno skrito kamero, ki že žanje milijonske oglede in se pojavlja kot tema debate na časopisnih straneh. Ime oddaje je Prank Encounters, ustvarjalci resničnostne serije pa so se zadeve lotili še malo drugače. Oddajo vodi (oziroma se skriva v reportažnem kombiju) sedemnajstletni Gaten Matarazzo, igralec in zvezdnik izjemno priljubljene TV-serije Stranger Things. Koncept pa je sledeč – popolna neznanca sta prepričana, da začenjata prvi dan v novi službi, a stvari se kmalu prevesijo v pravo situacijsko nočno moro, saj ne vesta, da je dogajanje okoli njiju zrežirano in da so vsi vpleteni zgolj igralci. Da oddajo vodi prav Gaten iz ZF-serije Stranger Things, ni naključje, saj ima Prank Encounters »nadnaravno« noto, zgodbe, ki jih uprizarjajo, namreč obravnavajo tematike, ki so na meji verjetnega – od Nezemljanov in duhov do hodečih in govorečih plišastih igrač ter obsedenih ljudi. Po vsej verjetnosti nastopajoče izbirajo po principu, da so nagnjeni k temu, da verjamejo v različne teorije zarote in »nadnaravne« pojave, zato da lahko na kameri posnamejo pristne reakcije, šok in paniko. O tem, ali je prav, da se izkorišča ljudi, ki mislijo, da so začeli prvi dan službe (torej prekarce, mlade ljudi, ki iščejo delo), bi lahko diskutirali, vendar je to najbrž tema za drugo rubriko.Izrazi groze na obrazih nastopajočih, ki se znajdejo v družbi morilskih plišastih medvedkov ali so v operacijski sobi priča rojstvu Nezemljana, so namenjeni zabavi masam gledalcev in temu, da se sprašujejo, kako bi v enaki situaciji reagirali sami. Če odmislimo krutost potegavščine prestrašenih ljudi, zasnova oddaje ni slaba, tudi izvedbeno je na visoki ravni (kakor smo pri Netflixu tudi vajeni), piko na i pa doda zvezdnik serije Stranger Things, ki ga nato, ko se razkrije, nastopajoči tudi prepoznajo.Če smo popolnoma pošteni, lahko sicer povemo, da ne gre za povsem originalno idejo, saj smo lahko nekaj podobnega pred časom gledali v oddaji Scare Tactics na programu Sci-Fi, le da je bil koncept zastavljen tako, da so nič hudega slutečemu nastopajočemu vse skupaj podtaknili tisti, ki so ga poznali – in v zgodbi tudi sodelovali. Tudi žanrsko so Scare Tactics (oddajo je v prvi sezoni vodila beverlyhillsica Shannen Doherty) opredelili kot humoristično grozljivko, seveda znotraj resničnostnega žanra skrite kamere. In tako kot pri Prank Encounters so pri Scare Tactics ponujali preverjene »nadnaravne« zgodbe, kot so ugrabitev Nezemljanov, napad jetija in morilske igrače. Zimzelene zgodbe iz znanih srhljivk ljudi pač vedno znova prestrašijo, saj so zaradi pop kulture prepričljiva referenca in so vtisnjene v našo podzavest.A ne glede na vse Prank Encounters v prvi sezoni ponuja šop zanimivih epizod in leta 2019 na novo piše zgodbo skrite kamere na televiziji. Vprašanje pa je, ali se lahko ta TV-žanr sploh še razvija. Glede na to, da smo se podobno spraševali v devetdesetih ter smo bili prepričani, da se ne more, danes pa je ponovno hit, je morda bolje, da se vnovič pustimo presenetiti.

Misha Tercek's column: Hidden camera like a horror movie
We had Mito Trefalt and Franco Kek who could be classified as classics, but the hidden camera has never developed on our soil since the 1990s.
05 Nov 2019, 09:10 by Novice



Birth of an Alien on a Hidden Camera PHOTOS: NETFLIX



Gaten Matarazzo, presenter


The classic hidden camera is already a very surviving format on television that existed sometime in the early 1990s. But since the element of surprise when you unknowingly put someone in a situation that is not real is still interesting to viewers (because it can be done in a thousand and one ways), television (as well as the internet) houses are always re-inventing new concepts for how Update your hidden camera and integrate it into more modern reality shows. The Rebirth of the Hidden Camera was launched in a unique way by Ashton Kutcher with a series of Punk'd shows launched by MTV in 2003. There, the superstar got the other superstars into unpleasant and unusual situations, and just before their nerves were released, he revealed that it was actually a prank. In terms of production and budget, the show was set at a fairly high level, and because of its high viewership and visibility, it attracted the attention of advertisers, so that in the following years the quality and crazy ideas only escalated. Punk'd inspired a number of related modern hidden cameras, which were then frowned upon again on television. We had Mito Trefalt and Franco Kek, who could be classified as classics, but hidden cameras have been on our floors since the 1990s ( and some of her later honeymoon attempts) she never developed further and was expected to be overtaken by time. But with foreign broadcast formats that were already light years ahead (and with the availability of cable, satellite and online programs), it was difficult for Slovenian television to compete at some point. And so it is today. Netflix has launched a new special hidden camera this week, which is already reaping millions of views and emerging as a topic of debate on newspaper pages. The show's name is Prank Encounters, and the makers of the reality series have dealt with things a little differently. Seven-year-old Gaten Matarazzo, actor and co-star of the hugely popular Stranger Things TV series, is giving the lead (or hiding in a reportage van). The concept is this - complete strangers are convinced that they are starting their first day in a new job, but things soon turn into a real nightmare, because they do not know that the events around them are cut off and that only the players are involved. It's no coincidence that Gaten from the Stranger Things ZF series is no coincidence, as Prank Encounters has a "supernatural" note, and the stories they stage deal with subjects that are on the verge of being probable - from extraterrestrials and ghosts to walking and talking plush toys and obsessed people. In all likelihood, performers are chosen on the principle that they tend to believe in various conspiracy theories and "supernatural" phenomena, so that they can record genuine reactions, shock, and panic on camera. Whether it is right to take advantage of people who think they started the first day of work (ie, precarious, young people looking for work) could be discussed, but this is probably a topic for another section. performers who find themselves in the company of killer teddy bears or witnessing the birth of an alien in the operating room are meant to entertain the masses of viewers and to wonder how they would react in the same situation themselves. Thinking of the cruelty of the scared prank, the design of the show is not bad, it is also high-level in performance (as we are accustomed to Netflix), and the dot on i is added by the star of the Stranger Things series, who is then recognized when it is revealed. to be perfectly honest, we can say that this is not a completely original idea, since we could have seen something similar in Scare Tactics on Sci-Fi a while ago, except that the concept was set up so that no harm can be heard all along prompted by those who knew him - and participated in the story. Also genreally, Scare Tactics (the show was first directed by Beverly Hillsman Shannen Doherty) was defined as a humorous horror film, of course, within the hidden camera reality genre. And as with Prank Encounters, Scare Tactics offered verified "supernatural" stories, such as alien abduction, yeti attacks, and killer toys. Evergreen stories from famous creepy people scare people over and over again because they are a compelling reference because of pop culture and are imprinted on our subconscious. But no matter what, Prank Encounters offers a bunch of interesting episodes in the first season and in 2019 rewrites the hidden camera story on television . The question is whether this TV genre can be developed at all. Considering that we were wondering in the 1990s and were convinced that it could not, but today is a hit again, it may be better to be surprised again.
